aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The defining event was a hard landing during landing-flare/touchdown.
The flight involved two pilots.
The flight instructor occupied the left seat.
The pilot occupied the right seat.
The flight instructor was 68 years old and male.
The flight instructor held a Commercial certificate.
The flight instructor held a Flight instructor certificate.
The flight instructor had a Single-engine land airplane rating.
The flight instructor had no other aircraft ratings.
The flight instructor had an Instrument airplane rating.
The flight instructor had Airplane single-engine instructor rating.
The flight instructor had Instrument airplane instructor rating.
The flight instructor had a Class 2 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The flight instructor's last Federal Aviation Administration medical exam was on July 17, 2012.
The flight instructor was not an occupational pilot.
The flight instructor's last flight review or equivalent was on August 31, 2012.
The flight instructor had 1710 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 304 total flight hours in this make and model.
The flight instructor had 1500 Pilot In Command hours in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 28 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 15 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 1 flight hour in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.
The pilot was 53 years old and male.
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot had a Single-engine land airplane rating.
The pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The pilot had an Instrument airplane rating.
The pilot had no instructor ratings.
The pilot had a Class 3 medical certification with waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last Federal Aviation Administration medical exam was on June 27, 2011.
The pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The pilot's last flight review or equivalent was on August 27, 2011.
The pilot had 953 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 200 total flight hours in this make and model.
The pilot had 920 Pilot In Command hours in all aircraft.
The pilot had 14 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
No toxicology was performed on the flight instructor.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight
Landing-flare/touchdown | Hard landing (Defining event)

## Flight instructor Information
Certificate: | Commercial; Flight instructor
Age: | 68,Male
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Left
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: |
Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane
Second Pilot Present: | Yes
Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 2 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | July 17, 2012
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | August 31, 2012
Flight Time: | 1710 hours (Total, all aircraft), 304 hours (Total, this make and model), 1500 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 28 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 15 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 1 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft)

## Pilot Information
Certificate: | Private
Age: | 53,Male
Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land
Seat Occupied: | Right
Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None
Restraint Used: |
Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane
Second Pilot Present: | Yes
Instructor Rating(s): | None
Toxicology Performed: | No
Medical Certification: | Class 3 With waivers/limitations
Last FAA Medical Exam: | June 27, 2011
Occupational Pilot: | No
Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | August 27, 2011
Flight Time: | 953 hours (Total, all aircraft), 200 hours (Total, this make and model), 920 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 14 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft)
